document.heading: LIHTC Rent Stabilization Exemption Clarification Emergency Amendment Act of 2025
To amend, on an emergency basis, the Rental Housing Act of 1985 to clarify that rental units participating in the Low Income Housing Tax Credit Program are exempt from the rent stabilization program.
document.text: BE IT ENACTED BY THE COUNCIL OF THE DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA, That this act may be cited as the "LIHTC Rent Stabilization Exemption Clarification Emergency Amendment Act of 2025".

section.text: Section 205(a)(1) of the Rental Housing Act of 1985, effective July 17, 1985 (D.C. Law 6-10; D.C. Official Code § 42-3502.05(a)(1)), is amended by striking the phrase "as defined in section 206(f)(2)(A);" and inserting the phrase "as defined in section 206(f)(2)(A), or any rental unit for which the housing provider receives tax credits pursuant to the Low Income Housing Tax Credit Program, as defined in section 2(5) of the Low-Income Housing Tax Credit Fund Act of 2004, effective April 8, 2005, (D.C. Law 15-299; D.C. Official Code § 42-2853.01(5));" in its place.

section.heading: Fiscal impact statement.
section.text: The Council adopts the fiscal impact statement of the Budget Director as the fiscal impact statement required by section 4a of the General Legislative Procedures Act of 1975, approved October 16, 2006 (120 Stat. 2038; D.C. Official Code § 1-301.47a).

section.heading: Effective date.
section.text: This act shall take effect following approval by the Mayor (or in the event of veto by the Mayor, action by the Council to override the veto), and shall remain in effect for no longer than 90 days, as provided for emergency acts of the Council of the District of Columbia in section 412(a) of the District of Columbia Home Rule Act, approved December 24, 1973 (87 Stat. 788; D.C. Official Code § 1-204.12(a)).
